body_html:
It works if I double assign a tf.get_variable though. Seems like this https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.9/tensorflow/python/training/checkpointable/base.py#L593 does not override/clear all previous state.

Edit: Also does not work for tf.layers.Dense and probably others.
body_text:
It works if I double assign a tf.get_variable though. Seems like this https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.9/tensorflow/python/training/checkpointable/base.py#L593 does not override/clear all previous state.
Edit: Also does not work for tf.layers.Dense and probably others.
body:
It works if I double assign a `tf.get_variable` though. Seems like this https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r1.9/tensorflow/python/training/checkpointable/base.py#L593 does not override/clear all previous state.

Edit: Also does not work for `tf.layers.Dense` and probably others.
